page.title: 18ST.NICHOLAS CHURCH HINXWORTH
page.content: {The Church}in Hinxworth,dedicated to St.Nicholas has stood for nearly 700 years; and it almost certainly occupies the site of an earlier church.No priest is mentioned in the Domesday Book but rectors were presented by the lords of the manor of Cantelupe early in the 13th century. Through the centuries the villagers have tended it and handed it down as a place of peace and hope. We still use it today as they did of old. The church is not often crowded but it is well supported and has a thriving Sunday School. We are ecumenical in outlook - Christians of other denomin- ations joining in the work and worship of the Church.Fundraising by the Friends of St.Nicholas help with the cost of church repairs, the latest venture was a community quilt raffled to raise money to refurbish the bells.
